sources.title: Vintage Wine
sources.description: “Fun and quirky” “There’s still some life in this old dog” “A lesser vintage” (IMDB reviews quotes). An absurdest comedy in which a wealthy vintner’s sons (who are older than their father) try to force him to retire. The affluent champagne estates owner is played by Seymour Hicks at the head of a large, lively cast. Good production values. IMDB rating 6.1. Directed by Henry Edwards. Released in 1935 (UK only). Complete print (PAL transfer minus a few missing frames).

sources.title: Vintage Wine
sources.description: Title: Vintage Wine Summary: The family head of a wine company refuses to retire, but his family have other ideas. Directed by: Henry Edwards Actors: Seymour Hicks, Claire Luce, Eva Moore Production Company: Gaumont British Picture Corporation Release Date: 20 June 1935 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 The family head of a wine company refuses to retire, but his family have other ideas.
